text: <@U11HH3P7Y> would you be able to help me get the ci-management plumbing in place for the baseimage stuff?
im still fairly unclear on the mappings there
yes. which job in sandbox I have to consider?
baseimage-experiment and baseimage-docker-experiment
baseimage-experiment should probably be something like “fabric-baseimage-vagrant"
and for the other, we need to be able to support $arch
so not sure if that is going to be three instances like “fabric-baseimage-docker-x86” etc
also note, at some point, we may want to delineate “verify” vs “release"
these would be in the “release” category, but I think that is a good place to start
will check these jobs and will get back to you
also note, there is “baseimage-trigger” which should front-end the “release” jobs somehow ideally
but for now, just getting the basic jobs would be great
ty
<@U0UHG4VP1>: kindly remove the atlas/dockerhub credentials from the sandbox jobs at earliest convenience
no rush, just dont want to forget about it in the future
(on that note, pls make sure that the credentials mechanism is in place in the mainstream jobs
<@U0KM61BCP> <@U0KN2SSKE> do you want me to target the further refinement of the baseimage pipeline to the v0.6 branch (e.g. v0.6.1 and beyond) or just mainline?
<@U0KPFAZNF> we use those credentials in production, so I know they’re there
ok cool
im thinking, if we need to do similar -sandbox experiments in the future, we can set up an alternate account (like hyperledger-sandbox)
otherwise, its a loophole to push images out
OK.
deleted
ty
<@U0KPFAZNF> what refinement do you mean?
i just mean: “the refinement in progress” not something specific to v0.6
ulimately, i hope to get the images all cleaned up and in a place where they could be deployed in places like Kubernetes
ideally, that would include v0.6
but if its felt that is inappropriate, i can just target mainline
brb
ghaskins: the CI pipeline is sub-optimal right now anyway, like 100% of that could be abstracted into one file which uses macros and a set of macros per platform. it just hasn’t been done yet.
ok
